page.title: 01THE SOUTH END - INTRODUCTION
page.content:
The{South End}is a very{sparsely {populated}area: it contains only{35 {people,}most of whom are farmers or fishermen. It is the most hilly area of the island and has by far the{best {views,}of Sanday and of the neighbouring islands. There are many sandy beaches, which make good walking places with spectacular views and lots of wildlife. On the east side of Hacks Ness, which extends south of this block, there are some exciting{caves. There is also an{archaeological {excavation}which is another main attraction to this end of the island.
A walk, in late October or early November, down to the tip of Spur Ness itself (beyond our block), takes you to a remote spot where you will find {Grey seal pups.
